response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "high", "Being a 22‐year-old male is associated with higher recidivism risk as younger males statistically tend to have higher rearrest rates."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Identifying as Black may be associated with systemic biases in the justice system, though it is not a direct indicator of criminal propensity."],
    ["Arrest History", "high", "Having been arrested twice, even without convictions, suggests a pattern of encounters with the criminal justice system that can be a strong predictor of future arrests."],
    ["Physical Characteristics (Height/Weight)", "low", "Physical measurements such as being 5'11\" and weighing between 175-199 lbs are not relevant indicators of recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married can indicate a lack of social support, which may contribute to a higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "medium", "Possessing a high school diploma without further college education may limit opportunities and has been linked to moderately higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Employment History", "medium", "Having held three jobs in the past year suggests some instability in employment, which can be associated with increased recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years is a protective factor, decreasing the likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not having felt depressed recently is a protective indicator since recent mental health issues can contribute to higher risk behavior."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a household of five with a biological mother may involve variable family dynamics, offering moderate risk depending on the quality of support and environment."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief that God plays a role in personal life can serve as a protective factor by providing personal structure and community support."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being a 22‐year-old male is associated with higher recidivism risk as younger males statistically tend to have higher rearrest rates.
Identifying as Black may be associated with systemic biases in the justice system, though it is not a direct indicator of criminal propensity.
Having been arrested twice, even without convictions, suggests a pattern of encounters with the criminal justice system that can be a strong predictor of future arrests.
Physical measurements such as being 5'11" and weighing between 175-199 lbs are not relevant indicators of recidivism risk.
Living alone and never having been married can indicate a lack of social support, which may contribute to a higher risk of recidivism.
Possessing a high school diploma without further college education may limit opportunities and has been linked to moderately higher risk of recidivism.
Having held three jobs in the past year suggests some instability in employment, which can be associated with increased recidivism risk.
No drug use in the past four years is a protective factor, decreasing the likelihood of recidivism.
Not having felt depressed recently is a protective indicator since recent mental health issues can contribute to higher risk behavior.
Growing up in a household of five with a biological mother may involve variable family dynamics, offering moderate risk depending on the quality of support and environment.
Belief that God plays a role in personal life can serve as a protective factor by providing personal structure and community support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 175 and 199 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
